Detailed Description

Abstract class using as base for the different kind of attribute of services.

The Attribute have a name, a description to give comments, and a description of the used format. The last description enables to give a XSchema for an XML attribute or an input or output in XML format.


Example of attibute : Variable, Input, Output.


The user needs only to use accessors to set or get to the data.

Author:
Sebastien Pesnel

void Attribut::GenerateHeaderDescription (  const SimpleString &  type,
const SimpleString &  name,
SimpleString &  str,
bool  end = true
)  [static, protected]
 

Add to a SimpleString the line : <[type] name="[name]"> or <[type] name="[name]"/> if end is true. where [type] and [name] are the value of parameter.

Parameters:
type [in] the tag name
name [in] the value of the XML attribut name
str [in, out] the SimpleString where append the data.
end [in] define if the tag is closed or not.

virtual void Omiscid::Attribut::GenerateLongDescription (  SimpleString &  str  )  [pure virtual]
 

Add to str a long xml description of the attribut.

This description contained the descriptions and other data defined in child class. The description information can be added to a string with the method AddTagDescriptionToStr (to implement in the child)

Parameters:
str [in, out] the SimpleString where add the description

Implemented in Omiscid::InOutputAttribut, and Omiscid::VariableAttribut.

virtual void Omiscid::Attribut::GenerateShortDescription (  SimpleString &  str  )  [pure virtual]
 

Add to str a short xml description of the attribut.

This description is composed by the kind of the attribute and the name. It can be generated with the method GenerateHeaderDescription. (to implement in the child)

Parameters:
str [in, out] the SimpleString where add the description

Implemented in Omiscid::InOutputAttribut, and Omiscid::VariableAttribut.

void Attribut::PutAValueInCData (  const SimpleString  val,
SimpleString &  str
)  [static]
 

add a CDATA section

add to 'str' the string 'val' in a CDATA section 

str <- str + "<![CDATA[" + val + "]]>"
Parameters:
val [in] the content for the CDATA section
str [in, out] add the section to the end of str
